body: The problem is with gulp-less not less. My bad.

Oh, no, I guess I'll reopen this. It looks like it's a regression bug (introduced with #1814?) because it's compiled as expected with v1.6.x.
(@vkbansal but this does not cancel the recommendation to clean your code up of a legacy hacks).

issue.title: Numbers get rounded when using `@arguments`

body: This also affects all mixins in [LESS Hat](https://github.com/madebysource/lesshat). Are there any workarounds or is this a bug in core?

@seven-phases-max I got this idea from [LESS Hat](https://github.com/madebysource/lesshat), which is heavily depended on such 'legacy hacks'. Its very useful.  [This is a mixin](https://gist.github.com/vkbansal/0d97f8e24ed48244e87b), I created for positioning of elements after having a look at LESS Hat.

issue.title: Values in mixins get unintentionally rounded with LESS#1.7.1

body: This [commit](https://github.com/less/less.js/commit/8580ff8c10dc67dea823a30d3294d2284c61dda1) caused the problem. Quick fix is to use the interpolation syntax `~"0.5"`.

@petrbrzek

Yes, most likely. Inline JavaScript stuff is not massively covered by the tests so we could just overlook the regression. I'll try submit a fix sooner (though it won't probably get into release soon since  v1.7.1 has been just released).

@vkbansal

> [This is a mixin](https://gist.github.com/vkbansal/0d97f8e24ed48244e87b), I created for positioning of elements

[Same w/o javascript](https://gist.github.com/seven-phases-max/804767ff02d8d0f1b4d1#file-style-lists-as-args-less) (I only changed property delimiter to `,` so the whole thing can be more generic).

(offtopic: Btw. this is the use-case where #1857 would come handy, implementation could become more simple (with args-pattern-matching instead of endless `length(@style) > n`)).

@seven-phases-max 
Thanks for the example. I did not know that it could be achieved that way. I was following the LESS Hat approach.

@seven-phases-max see commit, it was caused by weird code (that I don't think would have ever made sense) in the jsify function.

I'm planning a 1.7.2 release for this issue and one effecting alot of grunt users.
